6.09.text:
One of my passions, is really to surprise
the customer,

9.94.text:
We are always looking to play with different
flavours, different textures,

16.80.text:
I love to surprise our guests with special
creations,

20.22.text:
made of classic ingredients with a little
twist.

26.53.text:
From the moment you walk through the doors,
it is like a luxury palace.

31.45.text: Walk in, and you can feel the luxury,

33.28.text:
you listen to the beautiful music, you taste
the beautiful food,

40.84.text:
The music hasn't stopped; it just tinkles
in the background as you enjoy your luxurious

50.57.text:
We put a lot of love into the creation of
our afternoon tea.

53.25.text:
To treat them with the best quality they could
expect from a five-star hotel in London.

65.50.text:
At every stage there's a new surprise, it
really is the most fabulous treat.

71.21.text: Something people should do more often.

74.11.text:
It's just really nice to be able to make
that moment special for them.

110.36.text:
The flavours of everything we cook at cookery
school are really wonderful.

119.00.text:
At home I adore trying to recreate what I've
found in restaurants or bakeries. It makes

128.54.text: It has to look pretty, and it has to be delicious,

130.79.text:
but it has to have that kind of refined look
and feel and taste to it so,

134.90.text:
hopefully that's what we'll be recreating
in these tasks today.

140.22.text:
Fresh ingredients, local ingredients, like
the flour we get comes straight from the mill,

145.66.text:
the eggs come straight from the farm, the
butter,

149.03.text: it's really good old-fashioned proper food.

154.80.text:
It's just the smell of everything, it just
smells amazing.

158.52.text: It's hard not to lick your fingers!

163.03.text:
If you use wonderful ingredients, you get
wonderful food!
